snippet: The challengers include a student who was Yale’s first Jewish graduate and one whose his family was rich, slave-owning, and, by all accounts, white.
abstract: Newly emerging research may unseat recent claim that first African-American to graduate from Yale College was Richard Henry Green in 1857; research in journal Afro-Americans in New York Life and History asserts that mixed-race Jewish man Moses Simons graduated in 1809, while Yale identifies Randall Lee Gibson, who graduated in 1853, as another possible heir to the title.
lead_paragraph: The challengers include a student who was Yale’s first Jewish graduate and one whose his family was rich, slave-owning, and, by all accounts, white.

headline.main: New Contenders Emerge in Quest to Identify Yale’s First African-American Graduate
headline.print_headline: New Contenders Emerge in Quest to Identify Yale’s First African-American Graduate

keywords.value: Afro-Americans in New York Life and History (Journal)
keywords.name: organizations
